trustfund: TF021425-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT PROGRAM - BENIN,TF026435-STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT CREDIT II

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Second Structural
            Adjustment Program Project for Benin was satisfactory. The
            project achieved most of its objectives, institutional
            development was negligible, sustainability is likely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Several lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, adjustment operations extending over a three
            year period with an emphasis on macroeconomic stabilization
            may be of limited effectiveness for institutional reform
            given the short time frame in which they are generally set.
            Second, even at the micro level, well-articulated reform
            strategies should precede plans and their implementation.
            Third, more attention needs to be given to both achieving
            and maintaining a broad consensus on the reform program,
            especially in a new democratic environment. Finally,
            firmness on the part of donors when a program has gone off
            track can contribute to the emergence of a better basis for
            program implementation.
